Extend kableExtra colorization of Rmarkdown tables

Source: R/jamba-colors.r
kable_coloring.Rd

Extend kableExtra colorization of Rmarkdown tables

kable_coloring(df, colorSub = NULL, background_as_tile = TRUE,
  color_cells = TRUE, row_color_by = NULL, sep = "_",
  return_type = c("kable", "data.frame"), verbose = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

df

data.frame
colorSub

named vector of R colors, whose names match entries in the data.frame which are given these assigned colors.
background_as_tile

boolean defining whether a cell background color will appear as a rounded tile if TRUE, or a rectangle if FALSE.
color_cells

boolean indicating whether to color individual cells
row_color_by

optional vector of colnames found in df indicating how to colorize entire rows of a table. The typical colorization by cell will not fill the whole cell per row, so this colorization can be helpful to fill the remaining area.
sep

character delimiter used to combine values in multiple columns when row_color_by is supplied and contains multiple colnames. The delimited character strings are compared to colorSub to assign colors.
return_type

character string indicating the type of data to return. If row_color_by is supplied, then the only "kable" is allowed, otherwise "data.frame" is returned. Note that the "kable" option runs %>% row_spec() which returns an object only usable in downstream kable calls.
verbose

boolean indicating whether to print verbose output.

Value

data.frame or kable data.frame dependent upon the return_type argument. Note that even the data.frame returned will have colors encoded into each cell, so it will likely be difficult to manipulate.

Details

This function extends the kableExtra package, and is only available for use if the kableExtra package is installed. It is intended to allow specific color assignment of elements in a data.frame, but otherwise uses the kableExtra functions to apply those colors.

See also

Other jam color functions: alpha2col, applyCLrange, col2alpha, col2hcl, col2hsv, color2gradient, fixYellowHue, fixYellow, getColorRamp, hcl2col, hsv2col, isColor, makeColorDarker, make_styles, rgb2col, setCLranges, setTextContrastColor, showColors, unalpha, warpRamp

Other jam practical functions: applyCLrange, breakDensity, checkLightMode, colNum2excelName, fileInfo, fixYellowHue, fixYellow, getAxisLabel, handleArgsText, isFALSEV, isTRUEV, jamba, jargs, make_styles, mergeAllXY, minorLogTicks, newestFile, printDebug, renameColumn, rmInfinite, rmNA, rmNULL, sclass, sdim, setCLranges, setPrompt, ssdim

Examples

# Note the output will produce HTML code, which will
# open the Rstudio viewer when run inside Rstudio.
#kable_coloring(
#   df=data.frame(A=letters[1:5], B=LETTERS[1:5]),
#   colorSub=nameVector(rainbow(10), c(letters[1:5], LETTERS[1:5])),
#   row_color_by="B")
